definition:
The [**crosscap slide**]{} is an autohomeomorphism which can be defined
only for [**non orientable surfaces**]{} whose genus is greater than
one.

It is also known as the y-homeomorphism. This name was coined by
Lickorish and the name crosscap slide was introduced by Korkmaz.

1.  D.R.J. Chillingworth. [*A finite set of generators for the homeotopy
    group of a non-orientable surface*]{}, Proc. Camb. Phil. Soc.
    65(1969), 409-430.

2.  M. Korkmaz. [*Mapping Class Groups of Non-orientable Surfaces*]{},
    Geometriae Dedicata 89 (2002), 109-133.

3.  W.B.R. Lickorish. [*Homeomorphisms of non-orientable
    two-manifolds*]{}, Math. Proc. Camb. Phil. Soc. 59 (1963), 307-317.
